text:
det(I−λI) = (1−λ)n = 0, which has only one eigenvalueλ= 1 that oc-
curs ntimes. Moreover, Ix= λx= 1xholds for all vectors x∈Rn\{0}.
Because of this, the sole eigenspace E1 of the identity matrix spans ndi-
mensions, and all nstandard basis vectors of Rn are eigenvectors of I.
Useful properties regarding eigenvalues and eigenvectors include the
following:
A matrix Aand its transpose A⊤possess the same eigenvalues, but not
necessarily the same eigenvectors.
